com.compendium.ui.toolbars.system
Class UIToolBar

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JToolBar
                  com.compendium.ui.toolbars.system.UIToolBar
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class UIToolBar
extends javax.swing.JToolBar

This class extends JToolbar to hold some extra information for Compendium's toolbar system and to override some basic behaviours like drag/drop floatability.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

ALLSIDES

public static int ALLSIDES
Indicates the toolbar is dockable on all sides.

NORTHSOUTH

public static int NORTHSOUTH
Indicates that the toolbar is only dockable in the horizontal position, so North and South.

EASTWEST

public static int EASTWEST
Indicates that the toolbar is only dockable in the vertical position, si East and West.

Constructor Detail

UIToolBar

public UIToolBar()
Creates a new tool bar; dockable orientation defaults to ALLSIDES.

UIToolBar

public UIToolBar(int orientation)
Creates a new tool bar with the specified orientation. The dockable orientation must be either ALLSIDES , NORTHSOUTH or EASTWEST.

Parameters:
orientation - the dockable orientation desired

UIToolBar

public UIToolBar(java.lang.String name)
Creates a new tool bar with the specified name. The name is used as the title of the undocked tool bar and the tooltip on the docked toolbar. The default dockable orientation is ALLSIDES.

Parameters:
name - the name of the tool bar

UIToolBar

public UIToolBar(java.lang.String name,
                 int orientation)
Contructor. Creates a new tool bar with the specified name. The name is used as the title of the undocked tool bar and the tooltip on the docked toolbar. The dockable orientation must be either ALLSIDES , NORTHSOUTH or EASTWEST.

Parameters:
String - name, the name of the tool bar
int - orientation, the orientation to draw this toolbar.

setDockableOrientation

public void setDockableOrientation(int orientation)
Sets the docking orientation preference of this toolbar. This can be either ALLSIDES, NORTHSOUTH or EASTEAST. If any other int is passed, the dockable orientation is set to ALLSIDES.

Parameters:
int - orientation, the allowed dockable orientation/s of this toolbar.

getDockableOrientation

public int getDockableOrientation()
Returns the allowable docking orientation of this toolbar.

Returns:
int, dockableOrientation
